channel.title: Anyone got a bricked psp? More details inside!
channel.description:
Ok,
Ive been interested to see how many people are owners of bricked psp's (internal flash0 is corrupt)
im basically wondering this because I am working on a new mod for the psp (internal/external) and I need parts, and well I personally dont need it to start (nor do i wish to spend 200$ cad just to open it up for its hardware) So I was wondering if anyone would perhaps like to sell there bricked psp, i will pay a good sum for them (70-80$ *conditions apply)
Anyways if your interested give me a PM
And if this is by anyways against the rules (which i doubt it is, because im not selling anything just asking if anyone would be interested in selling to me) then dont hesitate to delete this thread =)
Anyways thanks =)

item.title: Anyone got a bricked psp? More details inside!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Buzzy:

Lol. I’m sorry, but why would people sell something that costs 200-250 dollars for 70-80, when the educated googler could fix it himself…

Why would people think of a bricked PSP as a bad thing?

A friend of mine bricked his psp the day he bought it, gave it to me with the box, receipt, so I went, bought another and took the old psp and a new box and took it back, got a refund. He got his psp, I got £80.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone got a bricked psp? More details inside!

item.title: Anyone got a bricked psp? More details inside!
item.dc:creator: @MoO MoO
item.description:
@MoO wrote:

Well true, but i need a hd that is A) small B) doesnt require alot of power, and can be run off of 3.6v (still not sure on this, but i could always rigg up a requlator. And something that would be relativly easy to make the psp reconise (via homebrew, or perhaps a plugin)

If u could find a hd, that is better suited to this (perhaps smaller would be a bonus, doesnt need 40 gb can be like 10-20)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Thats also a good idea! =] Although i wouldnt use a hard drive from an ipod. (as im sure there are other better hard drives out there)

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone got a bricked psp? More details inside!

item.title: Anyone got a bricked psp? More details inside!
item.dc:creator: @MoO MoO
item.description:
@MoO wrote:

hmm, from what i kno i doubt its possible to unbrick a psp? Because your dealing with internal flash memory, you would need some way to access that, and the only way i could think of doing that would be well, breaking open the psp and inserting a new motherboard (EXPENSIVE lol)

Anyways nah im trying to get parts for a mod ive been thinking off for a while, im trying to find out a way to remove the umd reader from a psp and replace it with a hardrive from a ipod (thus having 40-80gb instead of like 8 :p)

Anyways to do this im thinking u would have to probably have 2 batteries going (one to power the unit and the other to power the hd) aswell i would like to replace the up,down,left,right buttons with another joystick (thus socom becoming awsome :p)

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone got a bricked psp? More details inside!
